"You could try talking to the person and ask if they have any tips or strategies for completing tasks quickly and efficiently. They might be able to offer some valuable insights that can help you improve your own productivity."

"Another idea is to break down the task into smaller, more manageable parts. This can help you focus on one thing at a time and make progress more easily. You could also try using a timer to work in short, focused intervals, which can help you stay on track and avoid getting distracted."

"It might also be helpful to take a break and clear your mind before starting a new task. This can help you come back to the task with fresh eyes and a renewed sense of focus. You could try taking a walk, doing some light exercise, or simply taking a few deep breaths to help you relax and recharge."

"Another idea is to prioritize your tasks based on their importance and urgency. This can help you focus on the most critical tasks first and avoid getting bogged down by less important ones. You could also try using a task management tool or app to help you keep track of your progress and stay organized."

"Finally, it might be helpful to reflect on your own work habits and identify any areas where you could improve. For example, if you tend to procrastinate or get easily distracted, you might try setting specific goals and deadlines for yourself, or using techniques like the Pomodoro method to help you stay focused and on track."
